aptitude_questions.question: What is the next number in the series: 2, 6, 12, 20, 30, ?
A train running at 60 km/hr crosses a pole in 9 seconds. What is the length of the train?
If the cost price of 15 articles is equal to the selling price of 12 articles, what is the profit percentage?
A can complete a work in 15 days and B in 10 days. How many days will they take together?
What is the probability of getting a sum of 9 from two dice?
A sum of Rs. 7500 is invested at an interest rate of 8% per annum for 2 years. What is the simple interest?
The average of first 10 natural numbers is:
A shopkeeper allows a discount of 20% on the marked price. What is the selling price of an item marked at Rs. 1000?
If a car covers 360 km in 6 hours, what is the speed of the car?
The sum of angles in a triangle is:
What is 25% of 200?
If a train is moving at 60 km/hr, how much time will it take to cover 120 km?
The average of 5 numbers is 50. If one number is removed and the new average becomes 48, what is the removed number?
Find the missing number in the series: 2, 6, 12, 20, ?
What is the sum of angles in a triangle?
A person invests Rs. 5000 at 10% simple interest per annum. What will be the total amount after 3 years?
If the price of a product increases by 20%, by what percentage should the consumption be reduced to keep the expenditure constant?
What is the probability of getting a head when a fair coin is tossed?
The LCM of 12 and 15 is?
If A completes a work in 10 days and B in 15 days, how long will they take to complete it together?
A man walks 5 km towards North and then turns East and walks 4 km. How far is he from the starting point?
If the cost of 15 apples is Rs. 75, what is the cost of 25 apples?
The sum of two numbers is 25 and their difference is 5. What are the numbers?
What is the HCF of 36 and 48?
A car travels at 60 km/hr. How long will it take to cover 240 km?
Find the next term in the series: 2, 6, 12, 20, 30, ?
A person spends 40% of his salary on rent and saves Rs. 6000. If his total salary is Rs. 20,000, how much does he spend on rent?
A train running at 90 km/hr crosses a pole in 10 seconds. What is the length of the train?
What is the simple interest on Rs. 5000 at 10% per annum for 3 years?
A box contains 5 red balls and 7 blue balls. What is the probability of drawing a red ball?
A clock gains 5 minutes every hour. How many minutes will it gain in a day?
A number is doubled and then increased by 20. The result is 50. What is the number?
If the perimeter of a square is 48 cm, what is its area?
A train 150m long passes a pole in 15 seconds. What is its speed?
A person spends 30% of his salary and saves Rs. 7000. If his total salary is Rs. 10,000, how much does he spend?
A shopkeeper increases the price of an item by 20% and then gives a discount of 20%. What is the net change in price?
If a car travels 120 km in 3 hours, what is its speed?
What is the next term in the series: 1, 4, 9, 16, ?
A bag contains 8 red balls and 6 blue balls. What is the probability of picking a blue ball?
A sum of Rs. 2000 is invested at 5% simple interest per annum. What will be the total amount after 3 years?
A vessel contains 80 liters of milk and water in the ratio 5:3. How much water should be added to make the ratio 5:4?
A trader marks up his goods by 40% and allows a discount of 10%. Find his effective profit percentage.
A boat covers 36 km upstream in 4 hours and the same distance downstream in 3 hours. What is the speed of the stream?
A train running at 72 km/hr crosses a platform in 45 seconds. If the train's length is 180 meters, what is the length of the platform?
In how many ways can the letters of the word 'EXAM' be arranged?
A shopkeeper mixes two varieties of rice costing Rs. 40/kg and Rs. 50/kg in the ratio 3:2. What is the cost per kg of the mixture?
If the price of a commodity increases by 20%, by what percent should consumption be reduced to keep the expenditure constant?
A boat takes 6 hours to travel 36 km upstream and 3 hours to travel the same distance downstream. What is the speed of the boat in still water?
Two trains of lengths 120m and 150m moving in opposite directions cross each other in 9 seconds. If the speed of the first train is 60 km/hr, find the speed of the second train.
In how many ways can 5 people be seated in a row?
A mixture contains milk and water in the ratio 7:3. If 20 liters of water is added, the ratio becomes 7:5. Find the original quantity of milk.
A number is increased by 25% and then decreased by 20%. What is the net effect on the number?
A boat takes 8 hours to travel 64 km upstream and 4 hours to travel the same distance downstream. What is the speed of the stream?
Statements: All flowers are trees. Some trees are bushes. Conclusions: I. Some flowers are bushes. II. Some trees are flowers.
A train 150 meters long takes 30 seconds to cross a person running in the opposite direction at 6 m/s. Find the speed of the train.
In how many ways can 4 letters be chosen from the word 'GARDEN'?
A mixture contains 80 liters of liquid A and 20 liters of liquid B. How much liquid B should be added so that B becomes 40% of the total?
A number is first increased by 40% and then decreased by 30%. What is the final percentage change?
A boat travels 30 km downstream in 3 hours and returns upstream in 5 hours. Find the speed of the boat in still water.
A train 180m long crosses a pole in 12 seconds. Find its speed in km/hr.
How many ways can 3 students be chosen from a group of 7?
What is the smallest number that is exactly divisible by 12, 18, and 24?
A mixture contains milk and water in the ratio 4:1. If 20 liters of water is added, the ratio becomes 4:3. Find the initial quantity of milk.
A bag contains 6 red, 4 blue, and 5 green balls. If one ball is drawn randomly, what is the probability that it is blue?
If the sum of two numbers is 72 and their difference is 18, what is the larger number?
The sum of the present ages of a father and his son is 50 years. After 10 years, the father’s age will be twice the son’s age. What is the present age of the son?
Find the largest four-digit number that is exactly divisible by 88.
A shopkeeper mixes two varieties of sugar costing Rs. 40/kg and Rs. 60/kg in the ratio 2:3. What is the cost per kg of the mixture?
Two dice are rolled. What is the probability that the sum is greater than 8?
A number when divided by 7 gives a remainder of 3. What will be the remainder when the square of that number is divided by 7?
A man’s present age is three times the age of his son. After 6 years, the father’s age will be twice the son’s age. Find the son’s present age.
The least number which when divided by 6, 9, and 12 leaves a remainder of 1 is:
A mixture of 90 liters contains milk and water in the ratio 7:2. How much water must be added to make the ratio 7:3?
A coin is tossed twice. What is the probability of getting at least one head?
What is the smallest number that leaves a remainder of 5 when divided by 8, 12, and 16?
If 5 is added to one-fourth of a number, the result is 11. Find the number.
The present ages of A and B are in the ratio 4:5. After 5 years, the ratio will be 5:6. Find A’s present age.
A number when divided by 11 gives a remainder of 7. What will be the remainder when twice the number is divided by 11?
A milkman mixes 30 liters of milk with 10 liters of water. What is the percentage of milk in the mixture?
In how many ways can 5 people be seated in a row if two of them must always sit together?
A boy is 3 times as old as his sister. After 4 years, the boy will be twice his sister's age. What is the sister's present age?
Find the greatest number that will divide 75, 105, and 135 exactly.
A vessel contains a mixture of milk and water in the ratio 5:2. How much water must be added to make the ratio 5:3?
A bag contains 10 red, 6 blue, and 4 green balls. What is the probability of drawing a green ball?
A number when divided by 13 leaves a remainder of 8. Find the remainder when the square of the number is divided by 13.
